block.p: Melodie Anne Lane and Curtis Thomas O'Connor were married last evening by the Rev. Dr. Ronald M. Patterson at Marble Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, 43, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the executive director for education and development of the sales staff at Prescriptives International and Aramis, cosmetics companies in New York. She graduated from Emory University. She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen V. Lane of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla.
Melodie Anne Lane and Curtis Thomas O'Connor were married last evening by the Rev. Dr. Ronald M. Patterson at Marble Collegiate Church in New York.

The bride, 43, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the executive director for education and development of the sales staff at Prescriptives International and Aramis, cosmetics companies in New York. She graduated from Emory University. She is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen V. Lane of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla.

The bridegroom, 56, owns O'Connor Financial Services, which provides corporate retirement programs and investment management in North Haven, Conn. He graduated from the University of Miami. He is a son of Mary O'Connor of Point Pleasant Beach, N.J., and the late Leon J. O'Connor. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
